Review Text: This very smart British series is equally approachable.  While it reminds me a bit of the Lovejoy series, it has a distinct charm.
Review Title: Need more seasons!
Rating: 5.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/05/30
Average Rating: 3.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Arthur Lubin'], 'Producers': ['Charles R. Rogers', 'Joseph S. Tushinsky'], 'Starring': ['Ralph Bellamy', 'Constance Moore', 'Jane Powell'], 'Studio': ['Reel Enterprises']}
Review Text: Jane Powell is an American treasure!  I think she must be all of 15 in this film but she has the presence and voice of a seasoned pro.  The story is a little silly and I would have loved to see more of Louise Beavers.  But the opportunities to hear Jane Powell sing outweigh the faults.  I suppose I'm naive but I think sometimes its nice to see a film that's delightful.
Review Title: What an amazing voice!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/07/15
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]']}
Review Text: Sweet, charming, goofy and real. These are real people who are grateful for their good fortune. Enjoyable family fun.
Review Title: Sweet, charming
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/06/09
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'smoking'], 'Subtitles': ['English'], 'Directors': ['Richard Whorf'], 'Producers': ['Jack Cummings'], 'Starring': ['Frank Sinatra', 'Kathryn Grayson', 'Peter Lawford'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']}
Review Text: This is such a charming film. A young Frank Sinatra...oh my you can hardly believe how well developed his voice is. He was truly amazing. The duet from Don Giovanni sung with Kathryn Grayson really shows his range. I can watch it over and over again. Jimmy Durante is a gem. And Peter Lawford is perfect as the shy Jamie.
Review Title: Buy it. You won't be sorry.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of the purchase history reveals consistent positive sentiment towards charming, nostalgic, and musical content. The individual demonstrates a strong preference for family-friendly themes that evoke enjoyment and appreciation for talent, particularly in film and music. High ratings consistently indicated satisfaction, with average scores between 4.0 and 5.0, suggesting an affinity for quality entertainment.

Common themes emerge, showing a tendency towards vintage productions featuring well-known performers, particularly those with strong vocal abilities. The buyer particularly appreciates engaging storytelling despite minor flaws in narrative structure, indicating a preference for substance and character over critical or technical perfection.

Quality preferences lean towards well-acted films with musical elements, often praising the talent of actors and singers involved. The individual appears to favor productions that are heartfelt and evoke a sense of nostalgia or charm, and is likely less sensitive to price, considering the value offered by a delightful experience rather than solely focusing on cheaper alternatives.

In summary, this consumer values high-quality, wholesome entertainment, often nostalgic in nature, that showcases musical talent and storytelling.

target_interaction.title: Hoo-ray for Hollywood Hotel
target_interaction.text: The best version for Benny Goodman’s signature composition “Sing,Sing,Sing”. And Gene Krupa totally ROCKS that drum solo. Musical genius. Johnny Davis swings and sings and if you look carefully you see a baby Harry James next to him on the bandstand.
